alert.note: Alert for Grand Isle (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 7:27PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Clinton and northern Grand Isle Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 726 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chazy, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Beekmantown, Schuyler Falls, Chazy, Saranac, Mooers, Altona, Champlain, Jericho, Dannemora, Peasleeville, Rouses Point, Clayburg, Alburgh, West Chazy, Irona, Sciota, West Beekmantown, Mooers Forks, King Bay, and Morrisonville. This includes Interstate 87 between mile markers 163 and 175. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
